links.*: The Lord of the Rings (1978 film)
The Lord of the Rings (1981 radio series)
The Lord of the Rings (film series)

wikitext.*:
{{year-header}}
==February==
* '''[[25 February|25]]''' - [[Fraser Kerr]], who would voice [[Saruman]] in [[The Lord of the Rings (1978 film)|''The Lord of the Rings'' (1978 film)]], is born.
==March==
* '''[[16 March|16]]''' - [[Anthony Kenny]] is born.
* '''[[26 March|26]]''' -  [[Leonard Nimoy]], who would reach cult status both as Dr. Spock and with ''[[The Ballad of Bilbo Baggins]]'', is born.

==May==
* '''[[11 May|11]]''' - Artist [[Angus McBride]] is born.
* '''[[20 May|20]]''' - Actor [[Michael Spice]] is born.

==July==
* '''[[14 July|14]]''' - [[Robert Stephens]], who would voice [[Aragorn]] in [[The Lord of the Rings (1981 radio series)|the radio series of ''The Lord of the Rings'']], is born.
==September==
* '''[[12 September|12]]''' - [[Ian Holm]], who would voice [[Frodo Baggins]] in the [[The Lord of the Rings (1981 radio series)|BBC radio adaptation]] and play [[Bilbo Baggins]] in [[The Lord of the Rings (film series)|''The Lord of the Rings'' (film series)]], is born.
* '''[[19 September|19]]''' - [[C.S. Lewis]] invited [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] and [[Hugo Dyson]] to dine with him in Magdalen. A conversation followed that ran until 4 a.m. [[20 September|the following morning]] that was essential to Lewis's conversion to [[Christianity]].
* '''[[25 September|25]]''' - [[Peter Woodthorpe]], who would voice [[Gollum]] in both [[The Lord of the Rings (1978 film)]], and [[The Lord of the Rings (1981 radio series)|The Lord of the Rings 1981 radio series]], is born.
* '''?''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] abandons ''[[The Lay of Leithian]]'' and sends it to [[C.S. Lewis]] for review.

==October==
* '''[[15 October|15]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]'s poem "[[Progress in Bimble Town]]" is published in ''The Oxford Magazine''.
* '''[[30 October|30]]''' - [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] is appointed supervisor for B.Litt student [[A.F. Colborn]].
* '''[[31 October|31]]''' - [[Father Christmas]] writes a [[Letters from Father Christmas|letter]] to [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]'s children.
==December==
* '''[[23 December|23]]''' - Father Christmas writes a [[Letters from Father Christmas|letter]] to [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]'s children.

== ? ==

* Gabriel Tolkien, [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]'s first nephew is born.
{{Years|1928|1929|1930|1931|1932|1933|1934|}}
